body: This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343)

comment_regular_data.body:
Reviewed 1 of 45 files at r1, 1 of 3 files at r2.
Review status: 2 of 47 files reviewed at latest revision, 7 unresolved discussions.

---

*[toxcore/crypto_core.c, line 48 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZNZxLmyJE974Z508nB:-KZNZxLnnAWlptpLPrW8:b-mqel8s) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/48bc81f8d7f91b26629d875ac8fdac7a240e12fc/toxcore/crypto_core.c#L48)):*
> ```C
> #include <randombytes.h>
> #define crypto_box_MACBYTES (crypto_box_ZEROBYTES - crypto_box_BOXZEROBYTES)
> /* I know */
> ```

What do you know?)

*[toxcore/crypto_core.c, line 88 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZNbB1NaPmQjP7-bAOF:-KZNbB1Omk4ZiVhBm5RP:b-fgb4dg) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/48bc81f8d7f91b26629d875ac8fdac7a240e12fc/toxcore/crypto_core.c#L88)):*
> ```C
>    returns 0 if both mem locations of length are equal,
>    return -1 if they are not. */
> int public_key_cmp(const uint8_t *pk1, const uint8_t *pk2)
> ```

In `.h` file you specified `int32_t`. Same for all other `int` occupation

---

*[toxcore/crypto_core.c, line 90 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZNZeiW6tZKWR0Enn3k:-KZNZeiXtRVODgff0z_I:b-vcupk8) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/48bc81f8d7f91b26629d875ac8fdac7a240e12fc/toxcore/crypto_core.c#L90)):*
> ```C
> int public_key_cmp(const uint8_t *pk1, const uint8_t *pk2)
> {
> #if crypto_box_PUBLICKEYBYTES != 32
> ```

Why here not `CRYPTO_PUBLIC_KEY_SIZE`?

---

*[toxcore/crypto_core.c, line 118 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZNZqPxv4emVmLIFTjM:-KZNZqPxv4emVmLIFTjN:b-tjtcxh) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/48bc81f8d7f91b26629d875ac8fdac7a240e12fc/toxcore/crypto_core.c#L118)):*
> ```C
>  * return 1 if it is.
>  */

> ```

Update docs, please

---

*[toxcore/crypto_core.h, line 92 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZNaNFcq0mL9FNUz6d7:-KZNaNFdMUnmJtWe7cDc:bhw2wfl) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/48bc81f8d7f91b26629d875ac8fdac7a240e12fc/toxcore/crypto_core.h#L92)):*
> ```objc
>  * timing attacks could reveal that data.
>  */
> int32_t crypto_memcmp(const void *p1, const void *p2, size_t length);
> ```

Are you sure, that time of memcpy independent of input data?

---

*[toxcore/crypto_core.h, line 100 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZNaU1q8frYHQVoEfx2:-KZNaU1q8frYHQVoEfx3:b1i4ash) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/48bc81f8d7f91b26629d875ac8fdac7a240e12fc/toxcore/crypto_core.h#L100)):*
> ```objc
>  * memory is indeed zeroed.
>  */
> void crypto_memzero(void *data, size_t length);
> ```

But inside you use `memset`. Is it right?

---

*[toxcore/crypto_core.h, line 140 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZNcl7cEK4jh4HfEO5X:-KZNcl7dQpyCNl2db4PA:biz36vm) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/48bc81f8d7f91b26629d875ac8fdac7a240e12fc/toxcore/crypto_core.h#L140)):*
I think not return, but fill.

@return 0
> The crypto_box_keypair function randomly generates a secret key and a corresponding public key. It puts the secret key into sk[0], sk[1], ..., sk[crypto_box_SECRETKEYBYTES-1] and puts the public key into pk[0], pk[1], ..., pk[crypto_box_PUBLICKEYBYTES-1]. It then returns 0.

Removed docs. They are in the .h file already. --- *[toxcore/crypto_core.h, line 92 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZNaNFcq0mL9FNUz6d7:-KZNh2jQ-dC2oG6vi6T6:b-pgaz2s) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/48bc81f8d7f91b26629d875ac8fdac7a240e12fc/toxcore/crypto_core.h#L92)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
Are you sure, that time of memcpy independent of input data?
Yes. Not independent of input length, but any N sized string should take the same time. This means for instance that comparing "aaaa" and "aaaa" takes 4 time, and "aaaa" and "baaa" also takes 4 time. With a regular memcmp, the latter may take 1 time, because it immediately knows that the two strings are not equal. --- *[toxcore/crypto_core.h, line 100 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZNaU1q8frYHQVoEfx2:-KZNhPU6Bj8gDFATnfIM:b-lw6sq1) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/48bc81f8d7f91b26629d875ac8fdac7a240e12fc/toxcore/crypto_core.h#L100)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
But inside you use `memset`. Is it right?
Yes, that is not good, but fixing it is not in scope for this PR. --- *[toxcore/crypto_core.h, line 140 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZNcl7cEK4jh4HfEO5X:-KZNhXy67P8IoGGQbg3e:bhln7yo) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/48bc81f8d7f91b26629d875ac8fdac7a240e12fc/toxcore/crypto_core.h#L140)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
I think not return, but fill. @return 0 > The crypto_box_keypair function randomly generates a secret key and a corresponding public key. It puts the secret key into sk[0], sk[1], ..., sk[crypto_box_SECRETKEYBYTES-1] and puts the public key into pk[0], pk[1], ..., pk[crypto_box_PUBLICKEYBYTES-1]. It then returns 0.
Correct. Fixed docs. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343)*

*[toxcore/crypto_core.h, line 120 at r6](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-KZOdg4Gi88R3EPId20W:-KZOdg4Gi88R3EPId20X:by37bce) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/6b5e9ab12e408f79440674a59512e97c324a90af/toxcore/crypto_core.h#L120)):*
>@return 0 if both mem locations of length are equal, -1 if they are not.

What is "mem location of length"? Probably should say "0 if both keys are equal, -1 if they are not".

Might also mane sense to return a `bool`, though might be a bit too much work to edit all the code.

Uh, I stopping commenting on the comments. Way too many comments in this file need to be improved.

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 9 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-:-KZSjWQxAGNezWcwoqhp:b-jbsf8z)*

Now we need to improve the comments in crypto_core.h. It seems that the `new_symmetric_key()` function gets misused a lot in toxcore and it usage needs to be replaced with`random_bytes()` in many places. Some of those places are its usage in `tox.c`, `group.c` and `onion_announce.c`. I mean, just look at this ```C toxcore/group.h:#define GROUP_IDENTIFIER_LENGTH (1 + CRYPTO_SYMMETRIC_KEY_SIZE) /* type + CRYPTO_SYMMETRIC_KEY_SIZE so we can use new_symmetric_key(...) to fill it */ toxcore/onion_announce.h: /* This is CRYPTO_SYMMETRIC_KEY_SIZE long just so we can use new_symmetric_key() to fill it */ ``` --- Reviewed 38 of 45 files at r1, 2 of 3 files at r2, 1 of 1 files at r6, 2 of 3 files at r7, 2 of 2 files at r8, 1 of 1 files at r9, 2 of 2 files at r10. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/343#-:-KZ_GsDPRVVQBlxAu7LS:b6uqg39)*

Just to make it clear, the things I have described in my last comment are for the next PR. This PR looks good to get merged.
